website_summaries.verdict: You'll choose these claws over the two forks and bruised fingers option again and again. Comfortable and easy to use.
pros: Excellent at pulling the meat apart and shredding it quickly
Larger than forks, so they shred in less time
They don't have long handles, so they're easier to handle than forks
Great for puncturing meat to hold it in place with one claw while the other shreds
cons: The plastic is hollow on the underside, meaning there are large gaps that come to a point in the prongs
These are great places for food and debris to hide, and they are too small to get a dish scrubber in to clean

customer_reviews.title: OK, but does not eliminate a fork....
customer_reviews.text: While these are a nice way of securely handling a large piece of meat, I would not say they can replace a simple fork. They do a good job of reducing a Butt to smaller chunks, the teeth are too large and too far apart to get the pork to a final size. I also wish that the back of them was solid and not hollowed out. It would make cleaning them a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Ronspr

customer_reviews.title: Perfecto.......
customer_reviews.text: Hi guys! Well got my chance to use the claws this weekend. Smoked us a nice pork butt with a great rub and these claws made it much much easier to shred for pulled pork sandwiches & tacos!!!! Must have! I imagine it will work excellent with brisket too!!!! The quality is great, sharp pointy suckers too!!! Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Just A Couple

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea but difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: These came in made of plastic and were hollow on the back. Perhaps I read the description incorrectly but I thought they were metal. They don't have enough heft to them to be able to do half of the things they said. Shredding is difficult because I can't get enough force to pull meat and you absolutely can't lift a hunk of meat using them because they slide back over your knuckles and you lose your grip. I have small hands and can't really use them, but got them for my boyfriend and they are difficult to use for even his large hands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick work on pork/beef loin
customer_reviews.text: These do the job they are intended for and are definitely made of durable material. It's nice to have these on hand to tear apart meat when it's still hot. You don't have to worry about trying to hold it still with one hand and shred because these are big enough to hold the meat still. Having these makes shedding large amounts of meat a quick job.
customer_reviews.author: Jess R.

customer_reviews.title: Bad ass meat shredding weapons
customer_reviews.text: I do alot of meat cooking. Before these came into my life I used to big old heavy duty forks to shred stuff. Looking back, I'm embarrassed at my primitive floundering. These are not toys. They are brutally sharp and effective at shredding meat. The user guide is funny because it explicitly warns to fight the temptation to pick these up and act like Wolverine of the XMEN. I instantly did it then read the warning and realized I was being stupid. The claws last, hold up to abuse and RIP stuff apart. Will never be without them again.
customer_reviews.author: Bobcat

customer_reviews.title: Over Priced for Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, but way over priced. Got a bear of BearPaws for a third of the price and they feel sturdier, and are more comfortable in you hands. They are made out of nylon material like spatulas and other kitchen tools. I’m going to be returning these. Like most item on Amazon... buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: PDM777

customer_reviews.title: Man Tools ...
customer_reviews.text: Shred that grilled masterpiece, yea baby! They work great but I withheld a star because they should be solid in design, not open in the back. They would be better if they were heavier and would be easier to clean, and keep clean, if they were solid. Worth the money though and they do make short work of shredding the meat.
customer_reviews.author: J Robin

customer_reviews.title: Shredder Claws
customer_reviews.text: I cook a lot of chicken that needs to be shredded. I was doing it with forks but it took forever. I kick myself for not buying this product earlier. It makes shredding super simple. The handles are easy to grip and comfortable. The ends are super sharp so it works fast. I use one to hold the chicken the the other to shred. I have tried several ways of doing it over the years and this is the fastest and easiest way of doing it!
customer_reviews.author: Cat Alley

customer_reviews.title: Hollow mesh on back
customer_reviews.text: They are hollow on the back. So if you use them to move raw meat, they really need to go through the dishwasher before you shred meat. I tried handwashing them, and the little nooks in the hollows on the back don't get clean. I really wanted solid claws that could be handwashed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work well stronger than they look
customer_reviews.text: Like these, they are a heavy plastic. the hollow areas behind the claws collects all sorts of stuff and can be a pain to clean. If you soak them for a bit it will come out much easier. I have also use a no stick spray but you have to be careful not to spray where you hold or it is a real adventure to hold on to them :) Price to performance/Quality, I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Houdini

customer_reviews.title: Yes to the meat claws!!
customer_reviews.text: If you want to know what it's like to shred your meat like Wolverine, these meat claws are for you. They are solid, well built, easy to clean and give you the best claws for turning your bbq, smoked or slow cooked meats into beautifully shredded meats. Easy to clean, easy to hold, all around awesome. Make exceptional gifts too, because who doesn't want to be like Wolverine?
customer_reviews.author: Ehimmelman

customer_reviews.title: Not for chicken
customer_reviews.text: I used bc I’m tired of shredding chicken for pasta or tacos but was disappointed it didn’t shred better! These things are durable and I felt we’re going to slice right through this chicken but sadly I was giving too much effort and gave up and cut/shredded my self. Maybe it works better on bigger meats/cuts of meat. Not for chicken! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Byrd House

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shredder claws
customer_reviews.text: I like the shredder claws and these are the best I have owned yet. Also can be used to transport roasts and meats. These seem to be sharper and do shred the Boston Butts, and Pork Shoulders well when we slow smoke the already Cajun brined meats to about 205 degrees F until it is falling apart and then these claws work very well and save much time in shredding the meats to make wonderful pulled pork for any purpose, as long as it is for eating! As good as this product is, the follow up customer service by the seller is even better! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Cajun GourmetTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Tools for Shredding and Gripping!
customer_reviews.text: So much better than expected! I love these lightweight yet EXTREMELY durable meat claws! I simply do not know how someone had not thought of these before; they are a great replacement for the unwieldy and not too useful cooking forks that tend to fail on meat transportation and shredding. The claws move full roasts effortlessly with none of those "oh crap!" moments when it looks like the meat may fall to the floor. They shred pork and chicken like butter. Amazing tools...I will definitely be buying more for other family members!
customer_reviews.author: QueenBee29

customer_reviews.title: Pulled Pork Shredder Claws
customer_reviews.text: These claws work great. My husband would always have to use forks to shred any of our me . He would complain about how his wrist would hurt after shredding meat with the forks . I seen these and ordered them. Of course he laughed at them, until he used them and was very impressed by how little effort he had to use to shred the meat. Great investment. Buy them you wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya Fallert

customer_reviews.title: Grab Your Meat
customer_reviews.text: I have used these claws now for a few of my cooking adventures. Tearing apart hot pieces of chicken when making chicken soup. Also for handling my succulent ribs. Turning and moving a full rack of ribs is a messy chore which usually results in two half racks. Where is the fun in that. Now I can flip, move, glaze in BBQ sauce with out tearing apart my ribs. And not having that splash of meat juice while turning with a spatula. This is a great utensil for the kitchen. I keep mine with all my sharp objects in the knife drawer. Where Grandchildren are not allowed.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Clark

customer_reviews.title: Shred it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband, who complains endlessly when I cook a pork roast for pulled pork. He hates the time and effort involved in shredding. He loved to act like Wolverine on the meat and it made the meal SOO much easier. He didn't read any directions or watch any videos, he just dove in and got the job done! We threw them in the dishwasher afterwards. Now he's showing them off when we have people over. He said, "Whatever you paid for these, it was worth it!"
customer_reviews.author: R. Dryja

customer_reviews.title: Cook like Wolverine!
customer_reviews.text: I got these as a gift for my brother-in-law who loves to cook. Not only do they look cool (he pretends he's Wolverine, of course), but they work great as well! They are plastic, which I didn't realize when I bought them, but I was pleasantly surprised that they're very sharp and withstand high temperatures, no problem. They really do cut down on time spent shredding chicken for chicken enchiladas or tearing apart a roast for pulled pork. When done, just pop them in the dishwasher or hand wash them. Either way, they seem to be non-stick and clean up very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui

customer_reviews.title: These make pulling pork so easy
customer_reviews.text: I had been shredding my pulled pork with two forks. As you can imagine, it would take forever to get all the pork shredded. These things are awesome. I can feel my bear primal instincts take over as I start a rippin and tearing...rippin and a tearing. I've noticed I'm starting to sleep more during the winter, and I'm starting to walk around on all 4's. Also, I have a sudden hankering for some salmon.
customer_reviews.author: Nuke X

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Great Service.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected; only better. These Claws are sharp and definitely meant for shredding your favorite meat or just moving large pieces of meat w/o burning your hands. I used them a few times this weekend for Kalua pig and a few BBQ pork butts. Made my job super easy and safe. The ability to shred while still hot so I could make sure the meat absorbed all of the juices was a big plus. After my purchase, I received an email from the owner of the company asking for any improvements or if there was anything I didn't like. To me, follow-up like that is how you gain new and keep existing customers.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to hold
customer_reviews.text: They are very comfortable to hold, work well, being plastic not sure how well they will hold up, but they seam ok, time will tell. Being plastic, they do clean up fairly well, but the back side is open and meat does get stuck in them and is a little difficult to clean, but I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great for any meat
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my grandson who loves to grill and cook with meat. He was super excited to get this and made a special point to tell me how thrilled and anxious he was to use it. I'll have to order a set for myself because who doesn't love pulled meat for tacos or sandwiches!!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth, C

customer_reviews.title: Where Have You Been the Last Several Years??? Well Worth it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are great!!! I love to BBQ and smoke meats as well. The are tough lightweight ergonomic shredding claws; "pick-it-up" claws and more!!! They have a good feel in your hands regardless of whether the tines are pointed in or out. On another point the company is responsive and customer oriented, and they welcome feedback and questions. I would suggest caution as they are in fact as sharp as they look; and if they do not look sharp, they should! I just happened to be watching "Diners. Drive-ins & Dives" and saw one of the cooks Guy talking about the and fired up Amazon! It worked and so will the Pulled Pork Shredder Claws.
customer_reviews.author: Lake Lizard

customer_reviews.title: They are easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Who needs Chipotle when you have these? They are easy to use, clean, and easily shred meat. Customer Service follows up after the purchase and delivery and does so with an edgy and appreciated sense of humor. To me, shredding the meat is the most difficult part of duplicated a Chipotle dish. The spices I use are easily discerned from my former frequent visits to Chipotle and I used coconut milk in the sour cream to achieve the same great creaminess and touch of sweetness as does Chipotle. It's a great tool for a reasonably inexpensive and nutritious family meal, unless you're vegan. Vegans won't need these.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Pizza

customer_reviews.title: Works Great but Poorly Designed Grip
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. I use them to shred about anything. My favorite use is to shred pork for carnitas, for pulled pork sandwiches and to shred left over pot roast for sandwiches. These are very well made. The only complaint I have is that they are a bit difficult to keep a grip on (hence the 4 stars.) If your hands become wet or 'saucy' you will have a difficult time keeping a grip. The grip is just not well designed. Of course, the more tender the meat you are shredding, the less problems you will encounter. Overall, I would consider buying these as a gift for someone despite the poor grip design.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jane

customer_reviews.title: Not useful at all
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to handle, very awkward to hold and pull the pork and also don’t do a good job on pulling it
customer_reviews.author: jkruem

customer_reviews.title: Pulled Pork Shredder claws and i am glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these Cave Tools, Pulled Pork Shredder claws and i am glad I did! First, I was impressed by the size, the hand feel is great- They are large, sleek and easy to work with. I used these claws on a 9 lb. pork butt and shredded the meat within 3 or 4 minutes! Where have these been my whole life? This beats the heck out of using two standard forks to pull meat. Additionally, clean up was easy and they are dishwasher safe. Great stocking stuffer and a essential for anyone who is serious about bbq, grilling and/or smoking meat.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Does not have this Southern's approval.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shredder claws as I was making 25 lbs of pulled pork; I did not like the way they shredded the meat nor how I had to grasp them for the task at hand. I went back to my original fork method and was happier....with tired hands.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.JB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I bought them mostly as a joke, but they work so well. I cook things like chicken and pork roasts in the crock pot a lot, and these work so much better than forks to pull the meat. I got them as a joke but who's laughing now: they really work!
customer_reviews.author: Colorado K

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that I didn't buy them sooner. Previously I used forks to shred any type of meat --- hated it! The claws are easy to use, easy to clean and perfect for shredding not only pulled pork, but also chicken for chicken salad and roast beef for burritos. I can't say enough good things about these claws.
customer_reviews.author: Henry M

customer_reviews.title: Looks a little silly, actually works surprisingly well
customer_reviews.text: Frankly, I bought these on a whim, as sort of a gag present. I was initially a little disappointed, as I'd been expecting metal, and not (reasonably heavy-duty) black plastic. I finally used them to actually pull some pork, and the damn things actually work pretty well. They're a little odd to use, since there's no structure to keep the claws in line with your forearm, so it takes some reasonable hand strength, but the pork came apart in a hurry. Yeah, it's a slightly silly uni-tasker, but small and useful enough that it's staying in my kitchen drawers.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Morse

customer_reviews.title: Sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: These are very cheaply made. The plastic is so thin that if you aren’t careful, you could slip where your hand goes in and get cut by the (hole) of the handle. They’re nice and sharp for shedding, but don’t try too hard or they’ll break
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Great new BBQ tool
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these meat shredders to test out on a hunk of a smoked brisket. Prior to these bad boys I used two large forks, but I must say these meat claws made short work of my glorious brisket. They are sturdy, sharp, and easy to grasp in order to get the job done; not to mention the price was great. Shipping was phenomenally fast and the customer service was excellent. I will definitely order from Cave Tools in the future.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Super cool and useful
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my meat claws! I felt like Wolverine when I was clawing my Christmas ham today. I have a lot of pain and weakness in my hands and the meat claws really made turning and carving the ham so much easier! I’m very excited to use them for shredding chicken and other meats. Or just walking around the house looking cool with meat claws! I’m also excited to download the recipe book that comes free with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BONNIE MOORE

customer_reviews.title: This ROCKS !
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my Dad, who has everything, as a Father's Day gift because they do love to cook. Not only did he not have them, I wasn't sure but he loved them! Mom has used them to get whole chicken out of the crock- pot, oven & clay pot. They rave how easy it is with the "Claws" without being afraid to lose it during transfer to the serving dish. They served a 5lb. Bar-B-que ( pork butt) they say it was shredded in minutes compared to the 20 + min. usual. This is the perfect gift for any cook especially if you've run out of great gift ideas!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.J.P.

customer_reviews.title: That extra hand I’ve been looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Sold! I’ve struggled carving up tri tip or other cuts of meat using a carving fork and a knife. I utilized the claw to firmly hold the meat and carve with the greatest of ease. No slip or rocking. Felt safe too. I highly recommend this inventive tool for BBQing!
customer_reviews.author: Duane C. Stanton

customer_reviews.title: These are Nothing Short of Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Up to the point of receiving these as a gift from my wife for Christmas, I used two forks. I can tell you the claws make all the difference in the world and work VERY well! They are also great for lifting roasts, turkey, chicken, etc... to and from the pan, tossing salads, and I am sure to discover more uses. I have NO complaints about this wonderful kitchen/smoker/grilling tool. They are a must have in any arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: The Yeti

customer_reviews.title: "These. Are. Awesome!"
customer_reviews.text: I gave these to my husband for Father's Day because he had been shredding pork with a pair of dinner forks. It's hard to find something to surprise him since if he needs an item he'll buy it. For some reason these had never crossed his mind. He was glad to receive them but after their first use he was ecstatic. The claws tore through the pork in an easy, efficient way that forks couldn't duplicate. They're power tools of a different kind! I'm putting these up there on the list of best gifts for him, because they are so useful but still inexpensive!
customer_reviews.author: wordplay2011

customer_reviews.title: Always wanted bear claws!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new claws. I used this product over the Fourth of July holiday at a family member's home, and had to order my own. Best tool for easily shredding a pork shoulder/pork butt, and quite useful for lifting large roasts. I also love using a single claw to securely hold a roast while slicing. No more sliced fingers from slipping meat! Inexpensive and versatile!
customer_reviews.author: Kras

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to clean. The backs are hollow and food gets stuck in every crack and crevice. Also starts to slip out of your hand because the plastic grips are too smooth and rounded. I bought a new stainless steel pair with wood handles that works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: PickyNikki84

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to shedded chicken and they worked beautifully. They make the chore easy and quick. I can see many possibilities when cooking/bbq large pieces of meat/roasts etc. using them to left or turn I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: tldelorm

customer_reviews.title: Hollow
customer_reviews.text: I expected these to be more solid, the inside of them is hollow which makes it difficult to clean well, I'm hoping the plastic is strong enough to hold up despite it not being solid. Only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Just use a fork...
customer_reviews.text: These do not work any better then a big fork. Made of plastic so they are not as strong as you would think.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Slippery gloss plastic, not a matte plastic. Overpriced but they get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: These claws look like a matte plastic in the photos but when they arrived, they are a glossy plastic. I was immediately concerned that they'd slip if they got any sort of fat/grease/juice on them. Sure enough, this morning when I was using them to shred two Pork Shoulders, they definitely got slippery. They are also not great for anyone with large hands. These are far better than using a pair of regular old forks but they are also not worth the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: cool product
customer_reviews.text: These really are a cool product but I'm giving them 4 stars because I thought these were stainless steel but they are plastic and honestly feel kind of cheap. They work perfectly fine though and make shredding meat a breeze. I would purchase them again but I do wish they were steel.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Komloske

customer_reviews.title: These claws make shredding meat an easy job!
customer_reviews.text: “I had already ordered a set of the shredder claws for myself this past summer. They do work great! I ordered this set for my son-in-law as part of his Christmas present since he BBQs a lot of meat. I didn’t order them until the 19th of December but they came plenty of time give them to him. Pleased with this company."
customer_reviews.author: Gwen Sibert

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband for Father's Day. He just started smoking a few months ago. He was so excited! Love that you reach out personally via email to buyers. I know some don't appreciate it but to me, it makes a person feel that their purchase is important to the seller! We tried the claws this Saturday. Our pork was really tough and HARD to shred. Had nothing to do with the performance of the claws. Not sure what we did wrong with the pork butt. We'll have to smoke another piece of meat so we can give them another try!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: these are awesome
customer_reviews.text: these are MUCH easier to shred meat with, and does a more consistent job then my prior "two fork" method. It provably isn't even half the amount of work than it used to be before I had these.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L.

customer_reviews.title: They are comfortable to hold and the claws are surprisingly sharp
customer_reviews.text: These claws cut my shredding time in half. They are comfortable to hold and the claws are surprisingly sharp. We tend to smoke large amounts of meat at one time and shredding can be a chore. With the meat shredder claws we were done in no time. Even if you are only shredding a few pieces of chicken, the claws will give you really nice shredded pieces, not the tiny little chopped up size you can get if you try to shed using a kitchen fork. These claws were a great find and a great price. I've been telling everyone I know to pick up a set.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: They're about as cheaply made as possible to the point where I feel like they might break apart and ruin a batch of ...
customer_reviews.text: These were inexpensive, I get it. They're about as cheaply made as possible to the point where I feel like they might break apart and ruin a batch of pulled pork. The back side (not pictured) is completely hollowed out, even the small tines are hollow. This obviously weakens them but it's also a hassle to clean. These will be discarded and replaced with something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Primenesia

customer_reviews.title: Don't use anything else!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for shredding pork, chicken, whatever! Don't know why I'd ever use anything else after this. They are sharp, easy to use, and a breeze to clean up. Fantastic item!
customer_reviews.author: krs

customer_reviews.title: Hollow and light plastic FYI
customer_reviews.text: I can't review them thoroughly as I haven't been able to try them out yet but I was surprised when they arrived, they are totally hollow on the inside, and there are no photos on the listing showing this. Just seemed a little misleading. They're plastic and light weight... but the reviews looked good so I guess if it works it works. Just wanted to warn people.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey F

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these as a Christmas gift for my mom. She LOVES them. They are sharp and shred any meat with ease. She uses them mostly for pulled turkey and she gets wonderful results every time with MUCH less effort on her part than prior when she would use two forks or her hands to shred.
customer_reviews.author: Krauzer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed, since based on the picture I was expecting metal. These do have sharp edges and points. I expect they'll work well enough for as long as they last, but don't expect them to stand up to serious user or kicking around in a random kitchen drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Maven

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my kitchen tool collection!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting these for some time now! Wow these will make my life so much easier in the kitchen. Sad I didn’t buy sooner! As soon as my son saw them, he wanted to “play” with them. These are very sharp and sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Thoughtful Gift!
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my dad. He was excited to use it to cut up the roast beast for Christmas dinner! I love the customer service I received. I think I will purchase one for my brother!
customer_reviews.author: MzBeausoleil

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: So far, we've only used the claws for shredding chicken breasts, but they worked really well. Very easy to clean - just popped them over the prongs in the top rack of the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: cjcshop

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! Why most chefs use utility grabbers to pull is beyond me. In addition arrived 8 hours earlier than expected which was just in time for me to use on a smoked pork butt prepared for Memorial Day weekend party guests!
customer_reviews.author: PrimeTime

customer_reviews.title: Returned these. Unhappy with the, quality. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned these. Unhappy with the,quality. I felt the hollow claws would trap food making the hard to clean and potentially easier to break.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Bruckner

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean!
customer_reviews.text: So far these have been a saving grace! Cut the time to shred a pork but I smoked down by half! They don’t take up much space in drawer and were easy to clean. I have had them for a year but only used a few times so far, but very happy I got them!
customer_reviews.author: Alesa B.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: The claws are very nice. They’re easy to hold and do the job. BEWARE: those points are sharp. Be sure to clean carefully and store with the point facing AWAY from your hands!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but broke after 6 months of solid uses
customer_reviews.text: I used them once a week or so and liked them. Sharp enough to get the job done, but not so sharp that you risked cutting yourself when grabbing them out of the drawer. They seems sturdy, right until one broke. Sad day. However, 6 months of regular use at this price points isn’t half bad
customer_reviews.author: James Palmer

customer_reviews.title: New weapon of choice
customer_reviews.text: I was resistant to buying these at first because they look pretty dumb and how could they possibly be any good. But the reviews are amazing, and the meat fork my wife wants is almost $100, so I figured we could use them for now. Holy cow, these are soooo f%@#&ing sharp!!!!! I cut my thumb just washing them! They are a billion times more effective than I could have imagined!
customer_reviews.author: Jey Woolf

customer_reviews.title: I wish the claws were thinner easier to separate the meat.
customer_reviews.text: I wish that I had got the metal ones. These feel awkward and not as sturdy as I had thought. I still use but the meat has to be really soft. The claws are to thick so it’s harder to shred. I use it more with cutting harder fruits.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Valerio

customer_reviews.title: While this may go against Alton Brown's hard and fast ...
customer_reviews.text: While this may go against Alton Brown's hard and fast rule of NO UNITASKERS! This unitasker is one most EVERYONE should have in their kitchens! Sure everybody has 2 forks...but does everyone have the time it takes to shred the meat with those time tongs when you have something as magnificent of the SHREDDER CLAWS??? I think not!!! Imagine how much time you'll save so you can tend to then more important aspects of your meal! Bam, dam, and thank you ma'am! You're done!!! **BOOM** (drops mic) Take that, Brown!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lori W

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: I hate shredding chicken. I would even avoid cooking it just because shredding with 2 forks killed my hands. Then I got these claws and they are such a game changer! My hands are saved and they shred so easily and quickly. Everyone needs a pair!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hoeffel

customer_reviews.title: I like them so far!
customer_reviews.text: It makes shredding meat so much easier than using forks! For people that are trying to be healthy and meal prep, I like using the instant pot to cook up a bunch of frozen chicken and then use these claws to shred it and I have shredded chicken throw on salad or in soup throughout the week. Easy to clean, just rinse them and put them in the dishwasher. Strong and sturdy too, definitely doesn’t feel like they’ll break anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Koestner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing!! I have rheumatoid arthritis and was a little concerned about how hard they would be on my hands. They are lightweight and comfortable, and even when lifting a chicken out of a deep crock pot my hands don't hurt. They shred great, which has always taken me forever because I keep having to rest. This was so quick! As soon as they arrived my husband, just as the shipping email stated, immediately grabbed them and ran around the kitchen pretending he was Wolverine :) In short, everyone in the house has a use and a love for them!
customer_reviews.author: K. Mclaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I was really excited about these but I was let down. I wanted them specifically to pull pork. They worked ok, but it doesn’t shred it as thin as I like it. At this point, I’m gonna go back and use 2 forks like before and hand these off to my husband for the other uses they have.
customer_reviews.author: ABell

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, works like a charm. Much better than trying to shred pork butt with ordinary forks. Plus you get to look like Wolverine. Ha ha
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter and she was skeptical at Ford but after using them she really likes them. Much better than using two forks she said.
customer_reviews.author: HS

customer_reviews.title: Super awesome gift.
customer_reviews.text: Let's be honest, these just look bad to the bone! Bought these as a Christmas gift and they were a big hit! haven't tried them out yet, but will update when we do! Might even buy some to stuff in my purse in case I need something for personal protection. I don't think anyone will mess with the girl who has meat claws.
customer_reviews.author: MichelleMyBell

customer_reviews.title: Plastic thought they would have been metal.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with the quality. Plastic crap. Returned them for my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Young

customer_reviews.title: Great tool with many potential uses!
customer_reviews.text: First time I used just one of the claws to hold baked potatoes to slice them. Much easier than a fork, and worked very well. So I am thinking these can be utilized for many uses other than just 'pulling' meat! The claws are rigid and feel strong, and are comfortable in my medium sized (female) hand! (No I do not have 'man hands'!) There is no odor. I am very satisfied with my purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: They are badass!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved them!!! I got them for my brother who thinks he is the grill God. He loved them so much he went to Sam’s and bought 2 pork shoulders just to use them. They are sturdy and fun to use. Buy them you won’t be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: michelle reinhardt

customer_reviews.title: solid and makes bbq so easy
customer_reviews.text: my dad said these have made pulling pork so much easier with his arthritis. very sturdy and solid. very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: danielle

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: These were very sturdy, thicker than I expected. I had been wanting a pair for a long time to shred meat as I hate using forks.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: first,I have to say I laughed out loud at the answer to the 3rd Frequently Asked Question....and yes, my husband put them on like Wolverine but said since the blades were smaller he just felt like a badger! second, this is a great product and incredibly easy to use and does a perfect job of shredding pork.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Great for BBQ.
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job. Shreds meat really well. Highly recommend for pulled porks and chicken. Just make sure you don't take unprotected hands with these to super hot meat as your hands will touch whatever these shred
customer_reviews.author: EastofWest

customer_reviews.title: They feel sturdy and work well - I thought they would be ...
customer_reviews.text: They feel sturdy and work well - I thought they would be heavier but being lightweight is a good thing once you get to working with them. I do wish the handles were longer because I like to shred in the crock pot while the meat/juice is still hot and your knuckles get a little too close to the heat. But...I don't know that they would work as well if they were designed any other way. I'm keeping them and will use them a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Lake

customer_reviews.title: Great! We bought 2nd set!
customer_reviews.text: I gave these to my husband for Christmas and he’s used them several times already. He bought a second set for our camper. Very useful!
customer_reviews.author: A. LaBass

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have found these years ago
customer_reviews.text: I love these things. If you've made it this far and are thinking "do I really need that?" just buy them. They're amazing.
customer_reviews.author: HockeyBrad

customer_reviews.title: Beef roast, all forked up.
customer_reviews.text: I found these not to be practical for beef. I made an attempt to shred a beef roast and had this roll while in my hand. I reverted to the good old fork method without a problem. I do know the beef roast had been processed long enough in the smoker when I used the fork method, it almost fell apart on its own. I'll try again after winter has left MN sometime next spring and do both pork should and another beef roast.
customer_reviews.author: Opa Craig

customer_reviews.title: I no longer dread the shred.
customer_reviews.text: I've used these shredder claws once since receiving them and am very glad to have them. I'm an amateur cook so don't often splurge on specialty equipment but I'd have bought these long ago had I known how easy they make the job. They're sturdy enough to really go to town when shredding. The form fits my hands nicely so control is good. The points are sharp enough to easily pierce meat without being so sharp that I worry about stabbing myself. Clean up was a breeze in the dishwasher. I'll likely prepare more shredded meat dishes now that I have these claws.
customer_reviews.author: User 144169

customer_reviews.title: Great for Brisket
customer_reviews.text: This product is sturdy and simple to use and clean. The claws come in handy when shredding large amounts of Brisket (pork or beef).
customer_reviews.author: mateo

customer_reviews.title: I was able to use them for the first time last night and I absolutely LOVE them. They are very sturdy and comfortable to ...
customer_reviews.text: “ I was so excited to get these. I make a lot of dishes where I need to shred chicken, beef or pork and it's difficult and time consuming using regular household forks. I was able to use them for the first time last night and I absolutely LOVE them. They are very sturdy and comfortable to grip and made my job a lot easier! I think I may have to get a spare pair and let my friends and family know about them. "
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Cave

customer_reviews.title: These work great for back scratches
customer_reviews.text: These work great for back scratches, not really. Haven't cooked a brisket or pork butt yet, but they are definitely sturdy enough and am sure they will do a great job at shredding meat. Will use on pork butt for shredding and for other meats, will keep them handy to just grab meats to save them from the clutches of hot coals. Plan on taking them hunting with me in case I ever confront another bear I have to contend with.
customer_reviews.author: CLIFF TIGERT

customer_reviews.title: Alternate use
customer_reviews.text: Bought these last summer. They are very sharp and made of tough material. Tried using them as shredders but didn't like for that purpose. They do a great job of basic shredding overall but I'm particular about removing all the fat, so I've returned to using 2 forks. However, that being said, I have used several times for lifting heavy meats out of pan and works well for that. Just jam in the tines and lift. Also, these would work better with regular handles than the hand holes.
customer_reviews.author: C B

customer_reviews.title: Meh...just use forks
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would make it easy to shred pressure cooked meat. Forks work just as well and are easier to hold
customer_reviews.author: B. Link

customer_reviews.title: SHARP
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Only used once or twice, it was a gift for fathers day. Very sharp and seem durable. No complaints as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: J. J.

customer_reviews.title: Time saver! Love them.
customer_reviews.text: These are a huge time saver! I am glad I got them. So handy to use picking up hot meat, as well as shredding, which I do quite frequently.
customer_reviews.author: B. UTIFUL

customer_reviews.title: A Keeper for sure!
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit I was unsure about these "Cave Claws"....but they do work superbly for pulled pork.....so fast and easy! They work with ham & chicken as well..... Be careful they are very sharp. Gonna order another set for the RV.
customer_reviews.author: Parkerville

customer_reviews.title: Very well-built product!
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a chance to use them yet but can tell that they are very well made and should get the job done in good shape."
customer_reviews.author: Mike West

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for shredding meat!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect - I'm not a huge BBQer, but I do make shredded chicken and beef in the crockpot and it takes forever to shred the meat with two forks. Looking for something to make that easier. This was fantastic. I took a huge chuck roast out of the crockpot and these just tore it apart quickly and easily. Great - just what I was looking for! Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: kari

customer_reviews.title: Buy this
customer_reviews.text: A great purchase, even at double the price it would be a value. Shreds like a dream, great for lifting roasts as well for when you just want to move them and not shred them. It definitely belongs in your kitchen. As a side note, they warn you in the documentation that they are sharp and that you will be tempted to imitate the Wolverine when you first pull them out. I found out first hand the first part after trying out the second.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan C.

customer_reviews.title: Works, but frail
customer_reviews.text: These plastic forks do work, but they are ultimately pretty fragile. Inside their original box, being transported in a tote bag with some pellets and food containers, several teeth broke off of each fork. Nothing was dropped on them, but something may have gotten them at just the right angle. I've upgraded to stainless claw and haven't looked back.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Sweatt

customer_reviews.title: Effective and Durable
customer_reviews.text: We own a pizza restaurant and grind our own mozzarella blend cheese. Sometimes the cheese gets a little compacted into the bins where the cheese is stored for the day in our walk-in cooler and we are using the meat claws to loosen up or "comb" through the cheese. They work beautifully and everyone is really thrilled with them. Definitely recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: jdefranc

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were made of metal or Tritan given the purpose of them but it's just a matter of time til the plastic tongs break. My bf gave up and grabbed the regular forks to finish our pork. Bummer, I had it in my cart for like a year til the Chive convinced me to buy them Update: they have a lifetime guarantee and I was being skittish. Live long and shred muchaluckas
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Shred like a Boss
customer_reviews.text: I got these and they changed the course of my life from pit bbq guy to pit fighting champion. With these bad mammajammas I'm going full on Wolverine these days! "
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Toungate

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, grip is a little small.
customer_reviews.text: I have larger hands, not huge, but on the large side... Handles feel small- Easy enough to work with, but an extra 1/4” of handle width could make this product practically perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Lawrence

product_meta.title: Pulled Pork Shredder Claws - Strongest BBQ Meat Forks - Shredding Handling & Carving Food - Claw Handler Set for Pulling Brisket from Grill Smoker or Slow Cooker - BPA Free Barbecue Paws
feature_bullets: *** INSTANT 10% SAVINGS ON PURCHASE OF 2 OR MORE *** HIGH QUALITY PULLED PORK SHREDDER CLAWS dominate chicken, beef, brisket, turkey, poultry, hams, roasts and anything from your slow cooker, grill or smoker in record time
MEAT HANDLER FORKS NEVER LOSE GRIP - bear paw shaped so you can pick up and carry hot foods in the kitchen without dropping them or burning your hands
USE TO SAFELY CARVE LARGE FOODS - Heat resistant BPA Free pulled pork shredder claws never slip
COMES WITH 25 PROFESSIONAL BARBECUE RECIPES - step by step instructions and detailed grilling tutorial videos - Free Download Meat Smoking Journal iOS & Android App
LIFETIME SATISFACTION GUARANTEE - If at any point you are unhappy with your pulled pork shredder claws you can return it for a full money back refund. We Take Customer Service That Seriously
